oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The politics of free silver
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from E. W. Carmack to James Douglas Anderson regarding Mr. (Josiah?) Patterson's stance on the free silver question.

James Douglas Anderson was a journalist, lawyer and writer from Davidson County. E.W. Carmack, then-editor of the Memphis Commercial Appeal, would in 1896 successfully run against Josiah Patterson for a seat in the U.S. House of Representatives.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Carmack, Edward Ward, 1858-1908
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Monetary policy; Politics and government; Populism
